intro: Sida pakistanica, commonly known as the Pakistan mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, pale purple to white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Sida pakistanica is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antidiabetic effects.
